title: The Portrait of a Lady - knife metaphor

content.question: The metaphor developed in the fifth sentence (“The edges of her conduct . . . knife-like effect”) serves primarily to

choices.label: present Mrs. Touchett as a dexterous manipulator of her acquaintances
affirm the efficiency with which Mrs. Touchett manages her household
expose the malice underlying Mrs. Touchett’s disregard for others’ feelings
emphasize how uncomfortable Mrs. Touchett’s behavior makes certain people feel

content.answer: emphasize how uncomfortable Mrs. Touchett’s behavior makes certain people feel

skill.text: Skill 6.B: Identify and explain the function of a metaphor.
